intro: Cliffortia polygonifolia var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or pale green. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
